noun.description: Excessive discharge, especially of electricity; specifically the discharge of an accumulator or storage battery beyond a certain limit, especially so as to cause damage to it.

verb.description: To discharge (an accumulator or storage battery) beyond a certain limit.
Of an accumulator or storage battery: to discharge beyond a certain limit.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Scientific American. From over- + discharge<br>late 19th century (in an earlier sense). From over- + discharge.
